result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark Bradley Johnson

records.addlTxt: Motion hearing on November 11, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Pre-trial conference on January 4, 2023 at 10:30 am.

Activity: Arraignment 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

3:26 PM Defendant Mark Bradley Johnson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Shannon Murphy appeared by video for Mark Bradley Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney David Zarwell appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Information filed, copy to Defendant's attorney, reading waived. Defendant's attorney pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
9:54 AM Defendant Mark Bradley Johnson in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Shannon Murphy in court for Mark Bradley Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Emmeline Lee in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information. Bond continued.
Arraignment scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

9:21 AM Defendant Mark Bradley Johnson in court, in custody at the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Michael Shannon Murphy appeared by phone for Mark Bradley Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests continuance, State does not object.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.

11:00 AM Prosecuting attorney Emmeline Lee appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Shane Thomas Ploof appeared by video, in custody from the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Michael Shannon Murphy appeared by video for Mark Bradley Johnson. Attorney newly appointed and requests continuance. State does not object. Matter continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Activity: Initial appearance 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

3:50 PM Prosecuting attorney Mason C Braunschweig and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mark Bradley Johnson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Colin T Nicholson appeared by video for Mark Bradley Johnson. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address verified. Cash bond set of $6.000.00 with conditions: No contact directly or indirectly with victim NH, DH, MH, MDH, his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. No firearms or weapons, no acts or threats of violence. Preliminary hearing requested within time limits and by zoom. Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 11AM.
No contact directly or indirectly with victim NH, DH, MH, MDH, his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. No firearms or weapons, no acts or threats of violence.
